author: JAVAID UR RAHMAN
title: Political chaos; is a final showdown looming?
text: ISLAMABAD - The country’s political panorama has not been seeing any dull moment for last over a year. It seems the stage is perhaps set for the ultimate political showdow at least over the matter of turmoil between the ‘ruling clique’ and the PTI. The political tussle further aggravated when former spymaster was taken into military custody in the last week. Faiz Hameed, accused of abusing his power and raiding a private property development business, has often been accused in media of his association with former ruling party (PTI. The PTI, led by former prime minister, has been facing multifaceted political challenges in main government’s entities (Parliament, Election Commission of Pakistan and Supreme Court). Recently, the opposition party was seen staging strong protest against recent amendment in election bill to deprive the party of reserved seats. This amendment snatched from the PTI the privilege of becoming largest party in the National Assembly (NA). The ruling clique, once again, will be in a position for doing any specific legislation by enjoying two-thirds majority. With the arrest of county’s spymaster, the political pundits have started assuming military trial of former prime minister Imran Khan in the near future. The political party (PTI), with allies under the leadership of PKMAP chief Mahmood Khan Achakzai made a failed attempt to show its political muscle by holding a public gathering in Islamabad. The eleventh hour’s disapproval to hold public gathering created another political chaos in the country, as most of the roads leading to the Tarnol Chowk sealed with containers. The capital’s administration, avoiding untoward situation also sealed Red Zone area and other important roads. The PTI, without sharing any reason, called off its public meeting on the direction of its arrested leader from jail. Mahmood Achakzai, who is currently leading the opposition alliance known as Tehreek Tahaffuz Ayeen-i-Pakistan (TTAP), expressed reservation on this decision. A religio-political party chief Maulana Fazlur Rahman has also seemingly distancing from the PTI for last couple of days. Political experts viewed that the opposition alliance would make last ditch effort to hold public meeting in the next month for political survival of party and their leader. Some rumors are also circulating that some of PTI members would show disloyalty with party in the weeks to come. This political faction has also been under threat of military trial of its leader in the near future, which political experts viewed could hardly be avoided. PTI’s legal brain Shoaib Shaheen, sharing his comments with this newspaper, said that it would be very unfortunate if any attempt is made for military trial of Imran Khan. Shaheen, however, viewed that the military court decision can be appealed in the apex court. Some veteran politicians, desiring not to be named, expressed their views that this specific political battle is on the brink. The final political showdown of the current chaos is expected to reach its climax within the next two months at most.

organizations.name: election commission of pakistan and supreme court

author: Lauren McKeithen
title: Kathie Lee Gifford Explains Why She Has a 'Problem With Religion'
text:
Kathie Lee Gifford has never been timid about her Christian faith and how it guides every media project she tackles, from her time on “Live! With Regis and Kathie Lee” to the “Today” show. However, she’s also clear about the fact that she has a “problem with religion.” The 70-year-old author told The Christian Post, “I’m not a fan of it. I believe religion puts people in chains and faith in the living God is what redeems us from the chains, and following Jesus gives us the roadmap for how to be loving, how to be kind, and how to be everything Paul talked about. Love is patient; love is kind; love never wants its own way.”
Gifford continued, “How many of us live a life like that? I think we all basically want to. The Church, to me, has never been a building. The word is ‘ecclesia’ in Greek, and it really means ‘movement,’ a movement of God. That can happen in a building on a Sunday morning. It can happen in a synagogue on a Saturday morning. It can happen when you’re walking in the park; it should happen everywhere. The Bible says in Him we live and move and have our very being. That’s thrilling to me.” It’s this passion for making the Bible alive and active in an increasingly secularized culture that prompted Gifford to appear in the Amazon Prime series “The Baxters” alongside her daughter, Cassidy.
The 10-episode series, based on the bestselling book series by Karen Kingsbury, follows Elizabeth and John Baxter (Roma Downey and Ted McGinley, respectively) and their five adult children as they navigate life’s highs and lows both with and without God. The drama tackles themes like addiction, infidelity and divorce framed within a narrative of redemption and faith. The first season follows the couple’s daughter, Kari (Ali Cobrin), who discovers her professor husband, Tim (Brandon Hirsch), is having an affair with one of his students. Kari must find comfort in her family and faith to discover if love is a choice or if her marriage can be redeemed.
The series, Gifford said, addresses complex topics but does so with honesty and sensitivity that she hopes will spark conversations about faith, forgiveness and the possibility of redemption. “The challenge for ‘The Baxters’ is to make it relevant to people that are broke and never had a family that loved them, they don’t know what that looks like,” Gifford said. “‘The Baxters’ can help them see what it actually looks like. It’s a wonderful show. It’s not sappy; it’s not cliche. It’s real, and the writing is excellent.”
Gifford reflected on the authenticity and imperfection of the Baxter family and how the series portrays life as an adventurous journey of faith when aligned with God’s path. She said, “Sometimes we care too much what other people think and not enough of what God thinks of us. What God thinks of us is that He sees us wrapped in a robe of righteousness. He doesn’t judge us; He made us and loved us, and His Holy Spirit’s work in us is continuing every moment until He takes us home.”
Gifford continued, “We’re always in a state of evolution as believers, as human beings. If we choose the right road, and that’s, of course, His way, life will be an adventure. It’s not boring to try to live a life following Jesus. If your life as a believer is boring, you’re reading the wrong Scriptures. Get yourself the original Greek and the original Hebrew and study that. You’ll see it’s an active and alive thing. That’s the kind of faith I want.”

author: La Razón
title: Un estudio revela que la genética influye en cuándo los bebés dan sus primeros pasos
text:
Familia
Un estudio revela que la genética influye en cuándo los bebés dan sus primeros pasos
La mayoría de los bebés dan sus primeros pasos entre los 8 meses y los 2 años, una franja de edad que no indica problemas en el desarrollo
Los primeros pasos de un bebé son uno de los hitos más esperados por padres y cuidadores. Sin embargo, la edad a la que los niños empiezan a caminar puede variar considerablemente, y un nuevo estudio científico sugiere que la genética juega un papel importante en este proceso.
La genética podría explicar hasta un 25% de la diferencia en el inicio de la marcha
Investigadores de las universidades de Surrey y Essex (Reino Unido) analizaron los datos genéticos de más de 70.000 bebés. En sus hallazgos, publicados en Nature Human Behaviour, identificaron 11 variantes genéticas asociadas con la edad en la que los niños comienzan a caminar.
Según el estudio, hasta el 25% de las diferencias entre bebés que caminan antes o después puede atribuirse a factores genéticos.
¿A qué edad caminan los bebés normalmente?
La mayoría de los bebés dan sus primeros pasos entre los 8 meses y los 2 años, señaló la profesora Angelica Ronald, autora principal del estudio. Esta amplia franja de tiempo es completamente normal y no suele indicar problemas de desarrollo.
"Es un momento emocionante que marca una nueva etapa en la vida del niño", comentó Ronald.
Genes relacionados con el desarrollo cerebral y el aprendizaje
Los investigadores también hallaron que los genes implicados en el momento de empezar a caminar están relacionados con el desarrollo del cerebro, así como con un mayor nivel educativo en etapas posteriores.
Curiosamente, el estudio encontró que comenzar a caminar un poco más tarde —pero dentro del rango considerado normal— se relaciona genéticamente con una menor probabilidad de desarrollar TDAH.
¿Cuándo preocuparse si un bebé no camina?
La doctora Anna Gui, coautora del estudio, aclaró que no hay razón para alarmarse si un bebé empieza a caminar más tarde que otros. “Muchos padres se preocupan innecesariamente pensando que hicieron algo mal, pero la genética tiene un impacto considerable en este hito del desarrollo infantil”.
Aun así, si hay preocupaciones sobre el desarrollo motor del niño, siempre es recomendable consultar al pediatra.

author: RMC Sport
title: L'avis de Walid Acherchour : "Le management de Didier Deschamps m'inquiète" / Partie 1 – 27/06
text:
L'avis de Walid Acherchour : "Le management de Didier Deschamps m'inquiète" / Partie 1 – 27/06 13:05
L’émission qui dit tout haut ce que le monde du foot pense tout bas ! L’« After Foot », émission de foot la plus puissante en France, entame sa 18e saison ! « Génération After », émission composée de chroniqueurs qui ont grandi avec l’After, vous accompagne de 20h00 à 22h00. Avec Nicolas Jamain en chef d’orchestre, entouré de Kevin Diaz, Walid Acherchour, Ricardo Faty, Simon Dutin, Jimmy Braun et Sofiane Zouaoui. Au programme, des débats passionnés, de nombreux invités et de nouvelles chroniques. De 22h00 à minuit, place à la version originelle et historique de l’After autour de Gilbert Brisbois, Daniel Riolo, Stéphane Guy et Florent Gautreau. Les soirs de Ligue des Champions, Jérôme Rothen et Emmanuel Petit viennent renforcer l’équipe. Les soirs de matches, Nicolas Vilas et Houssem Loussaïef sont aux commandes de l’After Live, le nouveau rendez-vous qui réinvente le commentaire de match: au 3216, surs les réseaux sociaux ou le chat Youtube, venez participer. Cette année encore, Thibaut Giangrande pilote l’After Foot le samedi soir. author: Valley City Times-Record
title: Dallas Drainage Pros: Premier French Drain Installer In Dallas, Texas Expands Services | User | times-online.com
text: Dallas Drainage Pros, a company recognized for its expertise in drainage services, is excited to announce the expansion of its service offerings. The company, known as accomplished french drain installers Dallas , also provides an array of comprehensive landscape drainage solutions. Richard Hughes, CEO of Dallas Drainage Pros, says, "The crux of our service expansion is to meet the changing demands of our clients. We are fully dedicated to offering durable solutions, including French Drain System Installation, which involves the installation of a trench filled with a perforated pipe and gravel that redirects surface water and groundwater away from an area. We handle various drainage problems affecting both commercial and residential properties. Our reputation as yard drainage Dallas specialists is strong, and we strive to maintain that with every task.” Dallas Drainage Pros doesn't just stop at providing landscape drainage solutions. They are proud to be known as one of the most skilled french drain installers in Dallas. In addition to installing French drains, the company offers solutions to landscape drainage issues including Landscape Lawn and Yard Drainage Solutions, ensuring that your property can withstand heavy rainfall without flooding. Its team of professionals are highly skilled, focusing on managing rainwater runoff and preventing unwanted water accumulation and potential landscape damage. Meanwhile, Hughes highlights the rising necessity for professional drainage solutions, commenting, "It’s concerning to see many property owners lacking awareness about the possible damage unmanaged water can create, such as soil erosion and structural instability. This is why at Dallas Drainage Pros, we aim to educate homeowners and business property owners. Through our Yard Drainage Dallas offerings and Custom Channel Drains designed to handle large volumes of water, we provide maximum protection for their properties.” Customer testimonials clearly showcase the company's quality of work. A satisfied client reported, "The professionalism and commitment of Dallas Drainage Pros is obvious when you witness the quality of their work, including their expertise in Cleaning and Repairing French Drains to ensure they continue to function effectively. The comfort of knowing my property is protected from potential water damage due to drainage issues is invaluable. This was accomplished through the exceptional landscape drainage solutions by Dallas Drainage Pros ." Dallas Drainage Pros, recognized as proficient french drain installers Dallas, stays true to its core values of excellent customer service, professional service delivery, and creative solutions, tailoring services to meet each client's individual requirements, including Property Grading, Erosion Control, and Swales For Drainage to direct water away effectively. Dallas Drainage Pros aims to transform each consultation into a mutually beneficial relationship – whether dealing with new or existing clients. The company ensures top-tier service, demonstrated expertise, and ultimate customer satisfaction from the initial evaluation to the completion of each project, including Sump Pump Service Cleaning and Replacing, and Home and Basement Waterproofing to protect homes from water damage. By utilizing landscape drainage solutions by Dallas Drainage Pros, property owners can maintain their landscapes' aesthetic beauty and protect their investments from potential water damage. Importantly, they can increase the longevity of their properties. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LiJMbZ5rulE Dallas Drainage Pros has built its reputation by maintaining trust, integrity, and reliability. Its unwavering commitment to continued professional growth and exceptional service plays a key role in maintaining its industry-leader status. With every project, the experienced team at Dallas Drainage Pros reaffirms their dedication to quality standards, from yard drainage Dallas solutions to the installation of french drains. This further solidifies Dallas Drainage Pros' status as a reputable name for professional, effective, and dependable drainage solutions. ### For more information about Dallas Drainage Pros, contact the company here: Dallas Drainage Pros John 972-269-5639 dallasdrainagepros@gmail.com Dallas Drainage Pros https://dallasdrainagepros.com/ 972-269-5639

author: Victoria Scott
title: Fort Myers Beach lifts Hurricane Re-entry Pass Program
text: FORT MYERS BEACH, Fla. — Traffic on Fort Myers Beach is picking back up after the town lifted its Hurricane Re-entry Pass Program early Saturday morning. FOX 4 Community Correspondent Victoria spoke to the owner of Mom's Home Cooking about the positive news. She told Scott every bit of support helps after Hurricanes Helene and Milton set her back. You can watch Victoria's full report here: "We've had quite a bit of flooding, and we lost of course a bunch of plants," said owner of Mom's Home Cooking Heather Reagan. "It just keeps going and going." Reagan opened her food truck for the first time since Hurricane Milton made landfall earlier this week. It's a staple in town. "Everybody loves our cinnamon rolls and our biscuit sandwiches," she said. Now, she's just hoping mother nature cooperates. "The businesses are desperate for whatever little crumbs we can pick up, because with it being just one hurricane after the next after the next, it's very difficult to keep income coming in," Reagan said. She also credits the community for helping with all the cleanup efforts. "Obviously you can see the community is banding together to help get everybody back on their feet," Reagan said. Crews are still out cleaning debris and sand off the roads. Reagan said she's just hoping for a better year in 2025. "I'm really hoping that it'll be a nice calm summer. We'll have a lot of people come to visit."

author: christian.suarez@pulzo.com
title: Transmilenio se pronunció luego de que encapuchados encendieran bus del SITP en centro de Bogotá
text: [Redacción Bogotá](/nacion/bogota) Luego del [acto de vandalismo](https://www.pulzo.com/nacion/bogota/protestas-hoy-bogota-queman-sitp-frente-universidad-distrital-centro-PP3599978) que se presentó al frente de la Universidad Distrital, en la avenida Circunvalar con calle 26C, Transmilenio S.A se manifestó en contra de este tipo de hechos, y aseguró que acompañará a SUMA S.A.S., el concesionario al que pertenece el bus, para instaurar la demanda correspondiente en contra de los vándalos. Hasta el momento, la empresa no reporta heridos. Los pasajeros y el operador que conducía el bus fueron evacuados. Alcalde mayor de Bogotá se manifestó frente a caso de bus quemado durante protestas Por otra parte, el alcalde mayor de Bogotá, [Carlos Fernando Galán](https://www.pulzo.com/noticias/carlos-fernando-galan), se pronunció en sus redes sociales, donde hizo un llamado a las protestas pacificas, y resaltó la rápida reacción de de la Secretaría de Seguridad y de la Secretaría de Gobierno. Quemar un bus es un acto criminal, no una forma válida de manifestarse. No podemos permitir que las manifestaciones en Bogotá terminen en vandalismo ni en actos criminales, como el registrado hoy en inmediaciones de la Universidad Distrital en Ciudad Bolívar, donde encapuchados… — Carlos F. Galán (@CarlosFGalan) [April 25, 2024] Las manifestaciones fueron dispersadas y se habilitó el tránsito sobre ese corredor vial. Las autoridades de tránsito continúan realizando monitoreos. LO ÚLTIMO

author: Jonathan Hamard
title: La neige s'installe en France : voici la quarantaine de départements concernés par une vigilance ce vendredi
text:
du fun, des news, des bons plans... what else ? L'hiver prend ses aises sur le territoire et les Français doivent se préparer à une période de froid après avoir déplié leurs parapluies très régulièrement ces derniers mois. Si bien que la neige et le verglas qui s'installent progressivement poussent les spécialistes à placer plus de 40 départements en vigilance ce vendredi 3 janvier 2025.
2024 s'est terminée avec quelques gouttes, notamment dans le Nord de la France, après plusieurs mois très pluvieux qui en font l'une des années records en termes de pluviométrie depuis bien longtemps. Pas ou peu de neige sur les routes et dans les plaines, mais les vacanciers ont pu pleinement profiter de la montagne tout au long des deux semaines de congés associés aux fêtes de fin d'année . Les experts avaient d'ores et déjà annoncé que 2025 commencerait dans le froid , l' hiver étant désormais bel et bien installé. Ils se n'étaient pas trompés et pour la première semaine de janvier, écharpes, moufles et bonnets, sont de sortie.
La suite après cette publicité Jeudi 2, une vingtaine de départements avaient été placés en vigilance neige et verglas , consécutivement aux pluies qui se sont abattues et de la chute des températures. Finalement, le vendredi 3 ce sont pas moins d' une quarantaine de départements qui font l'objet d'une alerte. C'est ainsi que Météo France demande aux automobilistes, piétons ou cyclistes, de redoubler de vigilance aujourd'hui car les conditions de circulation pourraient s'en trouver grandement affectée sur la majeure partie Nord du pays.
Des risques élevés sur la moitié Nord du pays Dans le détail, on parle d' une diagonale au-dessus de laquelle le froid et l'humidité émergent pour se fixer , "du Centre-Val de Loire et de l'Auvergne Rhône-Alpes au Grand Est" . On stipule que la matinée de vendredi "est grise et froide, avec un peu de neige dès 400/500 m sur le Massif central et les Alpes du nord , des brouillards givrants sur le Nord-Est et un risque de plaques de glace par regel des sols mouillés en plaine ou enneigés sur les hauteurs " . En découlent nécessairement "de sols localement glissants en matinée" . Qui plus est, "excepté sur la façade Atlantique, le sud-ouest et le pourtour méditerranéen, les gelées matinales sont généralisées , comprises entre 0 et -4 degrés dans le nord-est, localement -5/-7 sur les plateaux du Jura" , toujours d'après Météo France .
La suite après cette publicité La liste des départements placés en vigilance jaune est connue. Précisément, on cite par ordre alphabétique : les Ardennes, l'Aube, le Calvados, la Côte-d'Or, les Côtes-d'Armor, le Doubs, l'Eure, l'Eure-et-Loir, l'Ille-et-Vilaine, le Jura, le Loiret, la Lozère, la Manche, la Marne, la Haute-Marne, la Mayenne, la Meurthe-et-Moselle, la Meuse, la Moselle, la Nièvre, le Nord, l'Oise, l'Orne, le Pas-de-Calais, le Bas-Rhin, le Haut-Rhin, la Haute-Saône, la Saône-et-Loire, la Sarthe, Paris, la Seine-Maritime, la Seine-et-Marne, les Yvelines, la Somme, les Vosges, l'Yonne, le Territoire de Belfort, l'Essonne, les Hauts-de-Seine, la Seine-St-Denis, le Val-de-Marne et la Val D'Oise. On ne craint pas tellement la neige qu'un risque élevé de verglas .
La suite après cette publicité Le redoux pour la rentrée des classes En effet, d'après Guillaume Séchet de Météo-Villes "la perturbation du jeudi continue de descendre sur les Alpes, le massif central et l’Alsace. Quelques flocons résiduels sont à prévoir, majoritairement dans l’est et dans les Alpes" , explique-t-il à actu.fr , avant de confirmer qu'avec "des températures proches de zéro dans la nuit de jeudi à vendredi à l'Est de la France, il risque d'y avoir du verglas" . L' Observatoire national interministériel de la sécurité routière prévient les usagers de la route des risques qu'ils encourent dans ses rapports annuels, expliquant que "des conditions météo particulières peuvent influer sur la mortalité routière, par une conjugaison de plusieurs effets parfois contradictoires. Des conditions agréables induisent une augmentation des déplacements" , dit-on, alors qu'à l’inverse "des conditions météorologiques dégradées peuvent accroître le risque individuel d’accident de chaque usager (visibilité, perte d’adhérence en cas de pluie, verglas, etc.)" . "Il est donc généralement difficile de repérer l’influence des conditions météo sur la mortalité mois par mois en dehors des variations les plus extrêmes" , tempère-t-on toutefois.
La suite après cette publicité Quid de l'après-midi du vendredi 3 janvier ? Les prévisionnistes tablent sur des "températures maximales" pas plus élevées que "2 à 6 degrés sur la moitié Nord et l'Auvergne Rhône-Alpes, localement 0 ou 1 sur le Nord-Est. Il fera 8 à 12 sur le Sud-Ouest et les régions méditerranéennes, parfois 14/15 en bord de mer et 17/18 sur la face orientale de la Corse" . Tous les Français ne sont pas logés à la même enseigne ! Samedi 4, la vague de froid devrait encore se faire sentir, alors que La Chaîne Météo laisse augurer un redoux le lendemain , dernier jours des vacances de Noël avant la rentrée des classes.
